page.title: 13CRIMES IN HUNTINGDON.
page.content: The majority of crimes are committed in daylight and are mainly theft. There are three main kinds of thefts. In 1984, 294 were house thefts, 843 shop thefts,510 factory thefts.In one theft a man stole 50 pairs of trousers and nobody noticed him.Other crimes include traffic offences,theft from cars and car theft.On average one car is stolen each week. Many crimes are difficult to solve and many questions have to be asked by the police attending a crime.Often a scene of crime officer and a finger print expert visit the scene of the crime looking for clues and information.If a criminal is caught he is sent to court and usually fined or sent to prison.
